schedule.title: Anatomy of a Microsoft Outage. Evolving our culture towards more Transparency
schedule.description:
Ever wondered how hyperscale cloud providers keep you informed during outages? In this deep-dive session from Microsoft Ignite, Rick Claus (Azure Engineering) and Tajinder Pal Singh Ahluwalia (Azure Marketing) reveal the secrets behind real-time notifications, transparency principles, and outage readiness strategies.

What You‚Äôll Learn:
- How Azure communicates during incidents using speed, accuracy, and transparency
- Setting up Azure Service Health for personalized alerts
- Understanding how we use "Brain" to identify issues and craft updates
- Best practices for outage readiness and resource-level monitoring
- Post-incident reviews (PIRs) and live retrospectives for continuous improvement

Resources & Links:
üìö Azure Service Health: https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/service-health/overview
üì∫ AIR Videos: https://aka.ms/air/videos

Speakers:
Rick Claus ‚Äì Principal Cloud Advocate
Tajinder Pal Singh Ahluwalia ‚Äì Azure Infrastructure Team

Hashtags:
#Azure #CloudReliability #msIgnite #DevOps #IncidentManagement #AzureServiceHealth #CloudComputing #ResilienceEngineering #MicrosoftDeveloper #itPro 

‚úÖ Chapter Markers
00:00 - Welcome & Session Overview
02:15 - Why Outage Communication Matters
06:40 - The Five Principles: Speed, Accuracy, Discoverability, Parity, Transparency
12:30 - AI-Powered Alerts: Meet Brain
18:45 - Azure Service Health Deep Dive
28:10 - Preparing for Incidents: Best Practices
36:50 - During an Outage: Communication at Scale
45:20 - Post-Incident Reviews & Live Retrospectives
52:00 - Lessons Learned from Azure Front Door Outage
59:30 - Resources & Next Steps

schedule.title: Kubernetes for the Rest of Us: Demystifying Cloud-Native for Windows Server admins
schedule.description:
Join us for ‚ÄúKubernetes for the Rest of Us‚Äù, a practical session designed for IT pros and operations teams navigating the shift from traditional VM-based environments to cloud-native Kubernetes. In this talk, Pierre and Vinicius break down the differences between managing VMs and containers, explore when Kubernetes makes sense (and when it doesn‚Äôt), and show how your existing skills still apply in this new world.

üè´You‚Äôll learn how to:
- Understand Kubernetes fundamentals and its impact on deployment processes.
- Manage secrets and environment variables securely using Azure Key Vault.
- Configure networking, ingress controllers, and DNS in Kubernetes.
- Apply governance and guardrails with Azure Policy.
- Monitor and maintain Kubernetes clusters using Azure Monitor, Prometheus, and Grafana.
- Optimize day-two operations, patching, and troubleshooting for SLAs.

This session includes live demos, practical tips, and real-world scenarios to help you confidently manage Kubernetes environments without losing sight of what matters most: keeping the lights on.

‚úÖ Resources & Links
https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/aks
https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/containers/container-insights-overview
https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/prometheus-grafana-overview
https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/governance/policy/concepts/policy-for-kubernetes
https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/intro-to-kubernetes/

‚úÖ Chapter Markers
00:00 - Welcome & Session Overview
00:14 - From VMs to Containers: What Changes?
01:36 - When (and When Not) to Use Kubernetes
04:15 - Secrets Management with Azure Key Vault
09:03 - YAML Deployment & Volume Mounts Explained
15:29 - Networking Deep Dive: Ingress & Load Balancers
21:00 - DNS in Kubernetes: Same Rules, New Approach
28:05 - Day-Two Ops: Monitoring, Patching & SLAs
33:00 - Prometheus & Grafana for Cluster Insights
42:00 - Governance & Guardrails with Azure Policy
45:30 - Best Practices & Wrap-Up

schedule.description:

Join us for an in-depth discussion on these topics and learn how to leverage them in your ADCS deployments.

schedule.title: Harden security and build resiliency with Windows Server 2025
schedule.description:
Security threats are evolving in new ways; new kinds of cyberattacks and new vulnerabilities are emerging rapidly, making it imperative for organizations to stay up to date with a trusted operating system to help protect against such threats. Microsoft Windows Server 2025 builds on decades of Microsoft security expertise to deliver security and resiliency for on-premises, hybrid, and cloud-based IT environments. Join us to learn about Microsoft Defender for Cloud, best practices for securing Windows Server and more.
